Column Comment.0: CALCULATION METHOD IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the method or formulaused to create a calculated or derived value.
Column Comment.1: FORMULA PART OBSERVATION NUMBER: A unique observation number for thispart of the formula.
Column Comment.2: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.3: ASSIGNED VARIABLE: the variable or portion of the formula that this row of datadescribes. In a formula A/B, one row in this table would describe A and anotherwould describe B.
Column Comment.4: COLUMN NAME: Part of a foreign key that allows you to point to the system, tableand column that contains the value to be used in this part of a calculation formula.
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.7: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.8: REMARK: Narrative remarks relating to this row of data.
Column Comment.9: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.10: SUBSTANCE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a substance that can be describedeither chemically or in terms of composition. Elements, ions, isotopes, isomers,minerals, chemicals, solvents, production substances, hydrocarbons etc are all listed.Be advised that many applications and agencies may use the same term, but thedefinition and composition details may not be the same. Use the SUBSTANCE XREFtable to capture relationships between substances, such as similar substances.
Column Comment.11: SYSTEM IDENTIFIER: Part of a foreign key to a database system that contains thevalue to be used in this calculation.
Column Comment.12: TABLE NAME: Part of a foreign key that allows you to point to the database tablethat contains the value to be used in this calculation.
Column Comment.13: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.15: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.17: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
